==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{Han compound|宀|子|c1=s|c2=p|t1=roof|t2=child|ls=psc}}.

===Etymology===
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*tsa ~ za||child; to give birth; to take care; to be kind}}. Related to:

* {{och-l|子|child, son}} (''also its phonetic component'')
* {{och-l|慈|to be kind, loving}}
* {{och-l|滋|to nourish, to grow}}
* {{och-l|詞|word, term}}
* {{och-l|辭|word, from testimony}}

Original sense (1): “to become pregnant, to give birth to, to nurture, to love” has essentially become obsolete. The sense (2) “letter, character” is either from a different root or a derivation from the sense “to produce, to generate”.

Cognate with {{cog|bo|ཚ་བོ||nephew}}, {{cog|bo|ཚ་རུས||descendant}}, {{cog|bo|བཙའ||to give birth to; to guard}}, {{cog|bo|མཛའ||kind, peaceful, friendly}} ({{zh-ref|Quan, 1996}}).

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|じ|yomi=o}}
Borrowed from Middle Chinese 字 with the southern [[pronunciation]] ([[kango]], [[Go-on]]).

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|じ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|じ}}

# a [[letter]], [[character]]
#: {{ja-usex|この字は何と読みますか？|この じ は なん と よみますか？|How do you pronounce this character?}}
# [[handwriting]]
#: {{ja-usex|彼女は字が上手い。|かのじょ は じ が うまい。|She has good handwriting.}}

====Counter====
{{ja-pos|じ|counter}}

# [[letters]], [[characters]]
#: {{ja-usex|４０字以内で書いてください。|よん じゅう じ いない で かいて ください。|Please write it down in 40 letters or fewer.}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|あざ|yomi=k}}
Shortened form of [[あざな]] ''azana'' "a section of a village" of ancient [[Japanese]] origin ([[wago]]).

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|あざ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|あざ}}

# a [[section]] of a [[village]]

=====Derived terms=====

* {{ja-r|小字|こあざ}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|あざな|yomi=k}}
